data.title: Location & Parking
data.text:
Location

3101 Wisconsin Ave, NW

Washington, DC 20016

Getting Here

The Cathedral is located in northwest Washington, DC in the Cathedral Heights neighborhood. The nearest Metrorail stations are Tenleytown and Woodley Park; numerous Metrobus lines have stops within the blocks immediately surrounding the Cathedral.

get directions

via foot or car/rideshare: Google Maps

via public transit: WMATA Trip Planner

Parking

There is very limited parking on the Cathedral grounds and in the surrounding neighborhood. We recommend planning to park in the underground parking garage on the Cathedral grounds, operated by Atlantic. Garage parking is free during Sunday worship services. Garage info:

Entrance: Enter via Wisconsin Avenue, at the traffic signal just south of Woodley Road.

Garage Hours: 6 am to 11 pm.

Maximum height: 7’ 6” including rooftop accessories. No trailers or RVs are permitted in the garage or on the grounds.

Accessible parking spaces: located on each level of the garage near the elevators.

Security office: located on level B1 of the garage next to the Wisconsin Avenue entrance.

Rates: Current Rates (PDF) Rates subject to change. For latest information, please visit asgpark.com

Pay station machines: located by the elevator lobbies on the B1 and B2 levels and also at the Wisconsin Avenue exit. Pay machines accept cash or credit cards. Credit cards or small denomination bills preferred. Change is issued in coins.

During select events, special rates and cash only may apply.

Visitor Entrance

The main visitor entrance is located on the northwest corner of the Cathedral (closest to Wisconsin Ave), directly across from the glass elevators. The accessible entrance ramp door is located just to the left as you face the main entrance.
